alert.note: Alert for Rapid City (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued November 07 at 12:22PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Air Pollution Alert for Dust for Rapid City west of the gap in effect until 5 PM MST this afternoon... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the South Dakota Department of Agriculture and Natural Resources. * WHAT...Southeast winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...West of the Gap in Rapid City. * WHEN...Through 5 PM this afternoon. IMPACTS...The gusty winds will suspend fine dust in the air and produce poor air quality. Hourly dust concentrations are available on the danr web page http://danr.sd.gov/Environment/AirQuality/AirMonitoring/ RealTimeData.aspx
info.instruction: The Rapid City Air Quality Office recommends the elderly, young, and anyone with respiratory problems avoid excessive physical exertion and exposure to the outside air. Voluntary actions to reduce dust pollution include, ceasing or reducing the manipulation of soil in construction, industrial, and agricultural activities, and increasing the use of pollution controls for soil stabilization, waste pits, stock piles, and construction sites.
